intro: Lastrea paucijuga, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lastrea, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern. It produces bright yellow flowers during the summer months, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability to arid environments, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
